intro: Weigela florida f. candida, commonly known as the white weigela, is a cultivar of the weigela plant native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its showy, semi-double flowers that are predominantly white, often with a slight pink or red tint. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, adding a striking visual appeal to gardens. Its foliage is dark green and glossy, providing a lush backdrop to the flowers. Weigela florida f. candida is a deciduous shrub that thrives in full sun to partial shade and is relatively low maintenance once established.
